Go from a summary matrix to an ultrametric phylo object.

Source: R/to_phylo.R
summary_matrix_to_phylo.Rd

Go from a summary matrix to an ultrametric phylo object.

summary_matrix_to_phylo(
  summ_matrix,
  datelife_query = NULL,
  total_distance = TRUE,
  use = "mean",
  target_tree = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

summ_matrix

A summary patristic distance matrix from sdm or median. See details.

datelife_query

A datelifeQuery object, output of make_datelife_query().

total_distance

Boolean. If TRUE it will divide the matrix in half, if FALSE it will take it as is.

use

A character vector indicating what type of age to use for summary. One of the following

mean

It will use the mean of the node age distributions.

min

It will use the minimum age from the node age distributions.

max

Choose this if you wanna be conservative; it will use the maximum age from the node age distributions.

target_tree

A phylo object. Use this in case you want a particular backbone for the output tree.

...

Arguments passed on to get_otol_synthetic_tree

otol_version

Version of Open Tree of Life to use

resolve

boolean; default to TRUE. Whether to resolve the tree at random or not.

input

Optional. A character vector of names or a datelifeQuery object

ott_ids

If not NULL, it takes this argument and ignores input. A numeric vector of ott ids obtained with rotl::taxonomy_taxon_info() or rotl::tnrs_match_names() or tnrs_match()

Value

An ultrametric phylo object.

Details

It can take a regular patristic distance matrix, but there are simpler methods for that implemented in patristic_matrix_to_phylo.

Contents

Developed by Brian O’Meara, Jonathan Eastman, Tracy Heath, April Wright, Klaus Schliep, Scott Chamberlain, Peter Midford, Luke Harmon, Joseph Brown, Matt Pennell, Mike Alfaro, Luna L. Sanchez Reyes.
